title: Chore: updating dependencies
body: This PR updates some dependencies to satisfy security notices.

title: Added "@file.txt" style inclusion of files for CLI args
body:
This PR adds the ability to include raw files as values to CLI arguments with the curl-like syntax `@file-to-include.txt`, e.g.:

```
$ wick invoke candle_ml/yolo:0.0.2 detect --with=@config.json -- --image_data=@soccer.jpg
```

The data is processed the same way as if it were parsed as a CLI argument value with the one exception being: if the destination type is `bytes`, then the file is read as bytes and encoded to wick-style base64 bytes.

title: Removed dead code
body: This PR gets rid of the old defaults handling code that stuck around.

title: Added event-stream handling to http client and raw router
body: This is a feature merge of #448 which overlapped a large refactor of the trigger crates.

title: Component model prepwork & RSocket alignment
body:
This PR updates to the latest wasmRS which brings in some re-alignment with RSocket and changes necessary to support component-model wasm components.

`wick` will remain backward-compatible with existing components, but new components will not run on older `wick` versions. This is not uncommon but is worth noting.

Other changes:
- Codegen changed to make data structures consistent across operations and calls to imported components.
- Removed the ancient native `stdlib` (`wick::` namespace). It was never documented, only used in tests, and most operations were superseded by `core::` or external components.
- Refactored triggers out of the runtime to support upcoming component model triggers. An experimental component-model trigger has been added for `command`-type modules.
- Added `unary_with_outputs` and `generic_raw` operation types to simplify common op definitions.

title: Changed `wick query` from jaq to liquid
body:
`wick query` was a holdover from ancient times and we've since adopted liquid as the common templating solution.

Since `wick query` was mostly used for value extraction, we can get the same usefulness with liquid and maintain near 100% backwards compat.

title: Added TypeScript configuration SDK
Add HTTP / HTTPS proxy support to HTTP Client component
Fix bad OS mapping in installation script
body:
This Fixes #442

I also added a `SUCCESSFUL` flag and a condition to keep temp files if an install failed.

title: Fixed broken links from moving root to`wick/`
body: There were a few links still broken from the reorg. This PR fixes them. It would be great to have all this logic in one place but I'm not sure if Hugo can support that (given its partials, templates, shortcodes lifecycles)

title: Removed unused crate
body: This PR removes an unused test integration crate from the project.

title: Added ability for `wick reg pull` to pull to the local dir (vs module hierarchy)
body:
This PR adds a few options to the fetch options so that `wick reg pull` can optionally pull directly to the local directory vs. pulling everything to the standard wick module hierarchy, i.e.:

Instead of 

```console
$ wick reg pull common/azureblob:0.5.0
Pulled file:
- ./registry.candle.dev/common/azureblob/0.5.0/azureblob.wick
- ./registry.candle.dev/common/azureblob/0.5.0/azureblob-http-client.wick
```

You can add `-F` (for flatten) to get:

```console
$ wick reg pull common/azureblob:0.5.0 -F
Pulled file:
- ./azureblob.wick
- ./azureblob-http-client.wick
```

This makes it easier to use existing registry components as templates to jump off of.

title: Added lax support for null/nonexistant variables in liquid templates
body:
This PR updates `liquid-json` to add support for setting defaults or otherwise handling non-existant values in liquid templates, e.g.:

```yaml
resources:
  - name: http
    resource:
      kind: wick/resource/tcpport@v1
      port: '{{ ctx.env.HTTP_PORT | default: 8999 }}'
      address: '{{ ctx.env.HTTP_ADDRESS | default: "127.0.0.1"}}'
```

title: Added optional directory listing for the static server
body:
This PR adds a configuration option to the static router that enables directory listings on missing `index.html` files. This is useful for serving generic files or for local testing.

![Screenshot 2023-09-13 at 12 39 16 PM](https://github.com/candlecorp/wick/assets/842798/36945f34-ef48-4790-9a9e-5f79522fdab6)

title: docs: added a wasm->component call example, cli example, and an examp…
body: This PR adds a couple WASM examples that show the different ways to make component calls from WASM as well as an example of how to generate Wick configuration with a WASM component.

title: Addressed minor issues with generated JSON schema
body:
The main purpose behind this PR is to address some inconsistent intellisense autocompletion stemming from the JSON schema.

This PR
- flattens the `$defs` structure in the generated JSON schema. According to the spec, the `$defs` structure should be flat, with each of the values being a valid schema reference.
- fixes some bad templates

title: Wasm imports
body:
This PR adds the ability for wasm components to import components directly vs. forcing components to be provided via the required/provides relationship.

Also in this PR:
- removed panic when wasm gets packets for unknown ports.
- made wasm->component calls via `[op_name]_raw` actually raw. They now only take and return a single stream of packets. The old implementation had excess generated code in it which cause the interface to be weird and not-at-all raw.
- made wasm->component calls via `[op_name]` always "not raw" - as in they will ignore the global raw setting. This is in preparation for the removal of the raw settings.

title: Made wick-config deps feature-dependent
body: This PR makes the `wick-config` dependencies optional and feature-specific. The purpose of this is to make (at least) v1 configs easily usable in `wasm32-unknown-unknown` targets so we can make wick components that generate configuration more easily.

title: Updated lint configuration, fixed lint errors and warnings
body: I updated the lint configuration and ensured that everything was passing in preparation for deeper memory profiling.

title: Added more progress events at startup
body: With the increasing size of applications, the time between a `run` or an `invoke` and seeing anything happen is growing. This adds progress events after each component is instantiated, as well as the time it took to do so to highlight progress and potential spots for improvement. Example output attached.

title: Fixed source of "could not decode body as JSON" warnings
body: When specifying the `Json` codec, the rest router was trying to decode the body as JSON regardless of whether the body exists. Since bodies are optional, the rest router needed to be updated to account for it.

title: Added `__dirname` to configuration context
body:
This PR makes `__dirname` available to configuration templates.

`__dirname` is set to the filename the configuration exists in.

Up for discussion: `__dirname` is available on the root as it feels different than the `ctx` namespace we have right now, i.e. `{{ __dirname }}` vs `{{ ctx.__dirname }}`.

The ctx context is relative to the component, configuration, its operations, etc. `__dirname` just *is*.

title: Fixed config template rendering for ops defined in triggers
body:
This PR fixes how inline operation configuration templates are rendered. Previously, operations in Triggers defined with configuration blocks were not rendered.

This PR also adds some `Builder` derivations that were found as gaps during writing a regression test for this issue.

title: Updated for chrono deprecation notice
body: A method wick uses was deprecated in `chrono`, this PR updates it to the recommendation.

title: feat: improved output of `wick list`
body:
This PR improves the output of `wick list` which hasn't gotten much love in a while and doesn't support outputting any configuration information.

Old output:

```console
Component: operation_name(input: object) -> (output: object)
```

```console
Components:
  └─ my_component with: { some_value: string }
     └─ operation_name (input: object): (output: object) with: { op_config_value: i64 }
```

Note: this PR also re-adds `Cargo.lock` to git which is required for CI cache and wasn't the source of cargo publish problems after all.

title: Updated rust template to default to raw codegen for now
body: While we redo the codegen and get rid of the build scripts, this PR updates the template to default to "raw" codegen so it's harder to fall into the substream footguns the legacy codegen had.

title: Support volume restrictions on `file://` urls, update SQLite URL support for it
body:
This PR adds support for applying `Volume` restrictions to `Url` resources if the URL is a `file://` URL.

The only notable side effect is that SQLite DB URLs must now use the `file://` scheme vs the custom `sqlite://` scheme. This is to avoid setting the precedent of some URL schemes pointing to files internally.

This PR also adds support for SQLite in-memory databases which can be enabled with the URL `sqlite://memory` (since it's special-by-default and doesn't point to any real resource). The errors thrown in either case point the user to the right syntax when possible.

title: docs: add deploy docs
Made wick-config versions conditional features
body: This PR makes v1 and v0 configuration parsing conditional features and the normalized `config` a conditional feature.

title: Added support for `wick invoke` on app configuration
body:
Historically, `wick invoke` would only work on component configuration, and making individual calls to operations in complex wick apps has gotten more difficult with provides/requires, root configuration, and resources. 

This PR adds `wick invoke` support for application configurations. When you do `wick invoke your-app.wick <path::component::operation>`, `wick` will instantiate a runtime and all children scopes, but will not start any trigger logic. It will find the appropriate scope by name and execute the operation in isolation. The `deep reference` syntax is IDs separated with two colons. E.g.,

```bash
$ wick invoke app.wick parent1::parent2::component::operation [same invoke config]
```

In addition, this PR:
- enables deep invocation support for `wick invoke` on components for consistency.
- refactors inconsistent, legacy naming in wick-runtime.
- changes the audit/lockdown component syntax from dot-delimited (`this.that`) to double-semi-colon-delimited (`this::that`) for consistency.
- changes the `__root__` audit/lockdown node to `__local__` to align with local Entities.

title: Fixed broken push on package with registry deps
body: This PR fixes an issue where pushing a component with registry dependencies would fail.

title: Made cron span less verbose
body: The old `trigger:schedule` span included the whole schedule object. This PR changes it to the cron schedule alone.

title: Ensured wasm calls send Done packets
body: This PR ensures that wasm->component calls send all the `Done` packets they're supposed to, preventing instances of wasm components hanging.

title: Removed darwin target configurations
body: Removing the `.cargo/config` for darwin targets. They were necessary for cross-compilation a long time ago and if they or similar are still necessary we can add them to the cross compilation build tasks, vs having them enabled for dev users.

title: Added packet assertions to wick test cases
body:
This PR adds the concept of assertions and operators to wick tests to improve the flexibility of test cases.

There are 5 initial operators, `LessThan`, `GreaterThan`, `Equals`, `Regex`, and `Contains` with `Contains` being the only one implemented right now. The former four are self-explanatory. `Contains` is a loose deep equality.

```yaml
tests:
  - with:
      url: '{{ctx.env.HTTPBIN}}'
    cases:
      - operation: post
        inputs:
          - name: id
            value: '1'
          - name: name
            value: 'wick'
        outputs:
          - name: body
            assertions:
              - operator: Contains
                value:
                  form:
                    from_root: 'nas.glhf.lan:9888'
                    id: '1'
                    name: 'wick'
          - name: response
            assertions:
              - operator: Contains
                value:
                  status: '200'
              - operator: Contains
                value:
                  version: '1.1'
```

title: Brought Postgres and Sqlite type support in line with Sql Server types
body: This PR brings the type coercion and abstraction from the MS SQL server side over to postgres and sqlite implementations.

title: Added lockdown configuration, `wick audit`, and `wick run --dryrun`
body:
This PR adds wick lockdown configurations, `wick audit` to help generate them, and `wick run --dryrun` to apply them.

Additional changes in this PR are related to fixes found during testing this feature:
- updated wasmRS to 0.15 to fix a bug with streams being prematurely closed.
- docs: updated CLI command descriptions
- refactor: unified CLI options and args for consistency and to fix component subcommands that need `with` configuration.
- refactor: removed legacy config argument

title: Fixed time trigger and made hard failures cancel the scheduler
body: The time trigger was broken via #407, but tests didn't catch it. This PR fixes the time trigger and uses the import name if it exists (instead of "0") and also makes the time trigger short-circuit the scheduler if an invocation fails.

title: Added configurable buffer size & caches
body:
This PR:
- drops the default buffer size of wasm components down to 512k from 5mb and makes it configurable via the `max_packet_size` option.
- adds a global configuration cache to reduce the fetching and parsing of configuration.
- fixes how triggers initialize the runtime to reuse imports if they already exist or have already been added by the trigger. This dramatically improves perf and memory usage for Rest Router applications.

title: Support provides/requires relationship in composite components
body:
This PR adds support for requires/provides relationships in composite components. The configuration parsed correctly, but the functionality was never added. This led to unexpected errors and an unintuitive experience. This PR officially adds the ability for composite components to `require` components and access them in flows.

POTENTIAL BREAKING NOTE: This PR makes the order of `import`-ed components important. During the changes above, I saw some random test failures that stemmed from the indeterministic ordering of rust's `HashMap` keys. This PR changes those structures to lists which will make them reliable but order-dependent. Components must now be imported in an earlier position than they are provided to other components.

title: Fixed "refusing to overwrite ..." errors on application runs.
body:
There were instances where two fetches of the same resource (file/OCI reference) could overlap and cause an error if they both tried to update the cache.

This PR fixes it two ways, one: by locking an `AssetReference` until a remote fetch is finished and two: by adding in more granular behavior controls for what to do when the situation occurs since it can't be prevented altogether. By default, the behavior is `Ignore`, and when you pull/run initially it is `Error` or `Overwrite` depending on CLI settings.

This PR also fixes a bug in the `Time` trigger that prevented errors from surfacing during the trigger init process.

title: Decoupled telemetry from log output
body:
This PR separates log and telemetry filter and levels configuration to be more granular. You can specify what modules you want logged to STDERR separately from what is sent to telemetry.

The default is similar to what exists now. Most of the `wick` namespace is logged at an `Info` level, `flow*` is logged at `Warn`, everything else is squelched. You can change it from command line settings, ENV vars, or the settings file.

*Updates*
- 2023-08-15: consolidated include/exclude to a single filter string.

**CLI args**

`wick run [file...] --log-filter='wick<=trace,flow<=trace' --otel-filter=flow=trace`

**ENV**

`LOG_FILTER="wick<=trace,flow<=trace" wick run ...`

**~/.wick/config/config.yaml**

```yaml
trace:
  level: info
  otlp: http://nas.glhf.lan:4317
  telemetry:
    filter: 'wick<=trace,flow<=trace'
  stderr:
    filter: 'wick_packet<=trace,wick<=trace,flow<=debug'
```

<details>
<summary>Original proposal</summary>

**CLI args**

`wick run [file...] --log-keep=wick=debug --otel-keep=flow=trace`

**ENV**

`LOG_INCLUDE="wick=debug" wick run ...`

**~/.wick/config/config.yaml**

```yaml
trace:
  level: info
  modifier: verbose
  otlp: http://nas.glhf.lan:4317
  telemetry:
    include: 'wick=debug,flow=debug'
  stderr:
    include: 'wick_packet=trace,wick=info,flow=trace'
    exclude: 'flow=debug'
```

Note: The CLI args are `xxx-keep` and `xxx-filter` where the settings and env are `include`/`exclude`. I'm open to suggestions one, the other, or something else.

One other option is to merge both into one string, e.g. `wick=trace,!flow=debug,wasmrs=info`

</details>

title: Ensured spans don't get filtered out by the logger.
body: The logger's filter function was inadvertently blocking spans which would cause an error down the line if an event was triggered for a span that had been filtered out. This PR ensures that spans don't get filtered.

title: Silenced missing tx warnings
body:
As the title states, this PR gets rid of the "still ... for missing tx, this may be due to a component panic or premature close".

It's never related to a user-perceivable issue and it doesn't give the developer anything to act on. It's a nuisance. The logic around the event loop needs to change anyway.

title: Better http client substream support.
body:
This PR makes the HTTP client a better streaming citizen. Previously the client would send a `done` for both body & response as soon as one request is complete. This changes it to complete only when the input stream and all output tasks are complete.

This PR also re-enables tracel-level packet logs because they were pretty handy.

title: Converted all level spans to info_spans
body: This PR converts all `debug_span!()` and `trace_span!()` macros to `info_span!()` because an `info_span!()` inside a `trace_span!()` will fail if trace_spans are turned off.

title: Misc cli fixes
body:
This PR
- fixes argument passing to `wick install`-ed scripts on *nix environments
- moves a chatty `warn` event to `debug`
- removes an unused cli argument from `wick config expand`
- fixes the missing help and usage text on invalid CLI commands

title: Reorganized tracing span hierarchy
body:
Previously, the tracing spans were loosely organized with `Span::follows_from` vs. a parent/child relationship, making browsing telemetry without pre-processing it impractical.

Now the spans are organized with a hierarchy that starts at a root invocation or a practical stand-in, like an HTTP request. Pre-invocation initiators can also pre-generate a transaction ID so their child spans stay better grouped. That means things like HTTP requests can report a transaction ID that can be used to query and filter all child invocations.

title: Chore: Update dependencies
body:
This PR:
- updates all dependencies and removes those that can be removed.
- sets `default-features = false` for all crates, adds features where used.
- consolidates any deps to the workspace.
- updates `include` directive in Cargo.toml to prevent including unnecessary items in published crates.
- BREAKING: removes shell expansion in v0 configurations so I could remove the `shellexpand` crate. There are no v0 configurations in known deployments and we should start officially deprecating them.

title: fix: fixed hanging tx for raw router components, removed bad debug line
body:
In this PR: 

- fixed hanging tx for raw router components
- removed bad debug line

title: Fixed path for rest-router example and tests
body:
Simple change to the rest-router example that sidesteps an issue appending the `openapi.json` path to the root.

That bug is capture in https://github.com/candlecorp/wick/issues/390 and needs its own fix, but this keeps the demo working in the meantime.

title: Removed unnecessary lifetime
body: Removed a lifetime that was causing an error on @shazaibn's build. It wasn't causing an error on mine, on CI, or on Release pipelines which is weird. Basic rustup troubleshooting didn't highlight anything different.

title: WIP: Added `wick install`
body:
This PR adds a `wick install` command that creates an executable in `~/.wick/bin` to install and run applications as you would other commands.

On windows: wick creates an `app-name.cmd` and an `app-name.ps1` file to issue a `wick run` on the cached application config.
On non-windows: wick creates an executable text file with a `/bin/sh` hashbang that issues a `wick run` command on the cached application config.

This is WIP while I write tests.

title: Made `wick run` the default subcommand if the first arg is a file that exists
body:
Rather than error out with help text if `wick` is run without an invalid subcommand, this PR makes the default subcommand `wick run` if the first argument ~contains a dot (`.`), forward slash (`/`), or a back slash(`\`)~ is invalid and is a filename that exists.


This was made largely to support hashbang syntax ( .g. `#!/bin/bash`) for executable files on *nix environments. There are still environments that don't support anything other than a hashbang and two, space-separated strings as the command to execute. Reducing `wick run` to `wick` makes it possible to have the executable line be the somewhat-standard: 

```bash
#!/usr/bin/env wick
```

So now we can make executable `.wick` files as easy as bash or perl scripts  🎉

Edit: changed the behavior of defaulting to `wick run` to also work with filenames that don't have slashes or dots.

title: Fixes: Slow-tx warning, relative volumes, XML codec -> Text
body:
This PR contains a few small fixes that were easy to pile in together:

- Fixes excessive "slow tx" warnings.
- Made the XML codec generic and renamed it to Text.
- Fixes an issue with `Volume` resources not being relative to the config defining them.

title: Added Sqlite3 & removed duplication in SQL component
body:
This PR:
- adds Sqlite support to the SQL component
- removes a bunch of legacy associated with the sqlx/tiberius shift for MS SQL.
- adds inline IDs to SQL queries (`$1` can be `${input_id}` now)
- adds a normalization step for MS SQL queries to translate `$1` to `@p1` (happens after the previous step so the inline-id approach will work OK).

title: Added wasi for v1 wasmrs components & helper macros.
body:
This PR adds WASI support for v1 wasmrs components.

Sample config:

```yaml
name: 'wasi-fs'
kind: wick/component@v1
metadata:
  version: '0.0.1'
resources:
  - name: ROOT
    resource:
      kind: wick/resource/volume@v1
      path: '{{ctx.root_config.root}}'
component:
  kind: wick/component/wasmrs@v1
  ref: build/component.signed.wasm
  volumes:
    - resource: ROOT
      path: /
  with:
    - name: root
      type: string
  operations:
    - name: read_string
      inputs:
        - name: filename
          type: string
      outputs:
        - name: output
          type: string
    - name: write_string
      inputs:
        - name: filename
          type: string
        - name: contents
          type: string
      outputs:
        - name: bytes_written
          type: int
```

As part of building the WASI test modules, I included experimental macros and proc_macro attributes for common operation cases. The WASI module showcases them but they're not necessary to rely on or use.

Breaking changes for component devs:
- There was an inconsistency to the naming patterns in `wick-component-codegen`. Everything generated for operations was housed under individual `operation_name::*` modules in the generated code, *except* the operation trait itself which was named `[OperationName]Operation`. This PR moves the operation trait to `operation_name::Operation`. To recompile old components, the operation implementations need to be changed from `impl OperationNameOperation for Component` to `impl operation_name::Operation for Component`.
- The `.error()` method on outputs now takes a `&str` instead of `impl AsRef<str>` due to becoming a trait methods vs generated code. Any call to .error that passed in a `String` or otherwise will need to be updated to pass a string slice instead (e.g. `outputs.output.error(an_error_string)` needs to be changed to `outputs.output.error(&an_error_string)`

title: feat: deploy base image with sqlite3
Improved port inference (+ added flow sequences)
body:
This PR improves `wick`'s ability to infer port names so they can be omitted more frequently. Because unary components are trivial to infer, the PR also adds the ability to chain flow expressions and omit IDs more frequently, i.e. `<> -> comp::op -> comp2::op2 -> <>`

While adding this, I added the `wick config` subcommand and two sub-subcommands:
-`wick config dot` to generate [dot syntax](https://graphviz.org) flow graph for a composite component.
-`wick config expand` to validate and output the expanded configuration that `wick` runs with.

This PR:
- Adds a "slow transaction" warning with active operations for transactions that last longer than 15 seconds without progressing.
- Starts operations on first packet vs starting them all at tx start. This means that downstream components no longer need to adopt the timeouts of their upstreams.
- Made wick's internal representation of configuration serializable (but not deserializable, it should always come from a v# config first).

title: Ensured missing values for optional fields do not throw an error
body: Fixes #378

title: Fixed overflow on switch freeze, closes #376
body: This PR fixes a panic when a `switch`'s input stream produces no data. Closes #376

title: Fixed rustdoc, cleaned up buildability of individual crates
body:
This PR:
- Fixes broken rustdoc
- Fixed issues building crates outside of workspace
- Adds a doc-check CI task
- Removes protoc from simple CI tasks

title: Composite component inheritance/delegation
body:
This PR adds an `experimental` block to composite configurations with an `expose` field which allows for composite components to delegate their implementation to an imported component. This is useful when supplying "batteries-included" components that pre-wire components and their required imports together.

This PR also includes some test file and example cleanup.

Sample config:

- updated: added `experimental` section
- updated: changed `inherit` to `expose`
- updated: removed experimental section, changed `expose` to `extends`, made it a list

```yaml
name: composite_inherit
kind: wick/component@v1
import:
  - name: COMP
    component:
      kind: wick/component/manifest@v1
      ref: ./flow_with_inputless_component.yaml
component:
  kind: wick/component/composite@v1
  extends: [COMP]
```

title: Improved how forgiving `wick test` is
body:
The initial `wick test` implementation tested a single stream of packets against a flat array of output packets. If there was any difference in order then the whole test would break.

This PR treats each named output as a separate stream (like the rest of wick does) so packets in varying order in relation to each other don't break tests. It is also more forgiving with `done` packets. Any done packets remaining from the stream won't break tests.

title: feat: Added http xml codec
Added raw call support to wasm codegen
body:
When importing components, the default methods naively decode types and don't account for substream bracketing. The default codegen should be improved but – in the meantime – this PR adds a `opname_raw()` complementary method to make the call and receive the unprocessed stream.

This PR also adds a formatter to the codegen so debugging is a bit easier.

title: Updated openAPI path + REST router modification
body:
In this PR:

- updated the openapi path to work as intended.
- replaced `name` with `id` in REST router config.

title: Memory/perf improvements
body:
This PR
- Moves fetching of wasm bytes til after we check the compiled cache
- Removed unnecessary clone of wasm bytes
- Removed weird circular reference of the `self::` component that stuck around over time.
- Added the `release-with-debug` profile to build optimized binaries that still have debug info.

Note: the old `just install-debug` task now installs an optimized build with debug symbols. The old dev build has been moved to a `just install-dev` task.

title: Removed protoc as a root dev dependency
body:
This PR removes the protobuf build script and moves it to a justfile task and a workspace-separate crate.

This means that codegen needs to happen manually (via `just codegen`) when the `.proto` file changes, but it also means that you don't need `protoc` installed locally unless you're actively editing the `.proto` files.

title: Improved performance of frequently used regex
body:
The OCI reference regex has some hotspots in it that aren't important to common use cases. This changes custom character classes to internal character classes (i.e. `[a-zA-Z0-9]` to `[:alnum:]`) and removes match bounds (i.e. `{0,127}`).

The result is a >85% perf improvement and improved memory usage. It's not a major bottleneck but the regex is used frequently when fetching/checking asset references so it helps.

title: Updated wasmtime and other wasm-deps
body:
This PR:
- Updates wasmtime and reuses an engine instance for wasm modules.
- Updates wasmrs-rust and leverages module caching.
- Adds a v1 token signature during the dependency updates to iterate without breaking existing modules.
- Adds a `mem-profiler` feature to the wick binary to help identify allocation hotspots.

title: Fixed MSSQL query panics on null
body: When the query result contained a null field, Wick would panic and throw `thread 'wick' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value'`. This PR fixes it by converting none to null values.

title: Fixed root config from being generated with raw packets when codegenning with `raw(true)`
body:
If you build the codegen with `raw(true)` to get access to unprocessed packets, it will generate `RootConfig` with Packets instead of decoded values. This wouldn't be a deal breaker if `RootConfig` didn't need to be default-capable.

This needs a better solution in the long run. This is a bit of a hack but highlights more of how codegen needs to be refactored to account for new usage.

title: Fixed infinite loop on sql server queries with no inputs
body: The sql server op implementation didn't have an escape hatch to stop executing queries if they didn't have any inputs. This PR fixes it.

title: Made StreamMap more resilient
body: This PR removes an `unwrap()` from `StreamMap` and gives a more useful warning if it encounters a packet on an unknown port.

title: Fixed "Too many connections to input port 'input'" errors for pluck path syntax
body: The generated pluck IDs didn't account for plucking multiple of the same path. This PR better differentiates them.

title: Changed pre-request middleware to one output union vs request/response race
body:
The previous middleware solution required operations to have two outputs, one request & one response, and used a "first-wins" approach to deciding how to act. This changes the output signature to be a union of either/or.

This also fixes encoding of enums which was breaking building composite middleware.

title: Added unions to type definitions
body:
Along with `struct` and `enum` types, this PR adds `union` to the list of formal types that wick supports.

Note: I would have preferred anonymous unions (i.e. like TypeScript `string | number | xxx`) but that's not easy to simulate in languages that don't support the concept natively. This PR implements unions as a top-level, named type.

title: Added substream support for switch statements & collect
body: This PR adds substream support for `switch` and `collect` operations along with some interpreter cleanup.

title: ci: enable windows binary
Added `broadcast_open|close()` on output structs
body:
When dealing with substreams, it's necessary to propagate signals downstream. This PR adds utility methods to ensure it happens consistently.

It also fixes the behavior for `--filter` in `wick test` and an erroneous macro branch.

title: Added `core::collect` component to collect a stream into a single object
body:
Added a `collect` component which can be configured with dynamic input names to collect every packet on its inputs and merge them into a single object. This is different than `merge` which merges sets of inputs into one object. This merges both success and failure packets over an entire stream into one value.

Configured like:
```yaml
uses:
  - name: COLLECT
    operation: core::collect
    with:
      inputs: ['results']
flow:
  - <>.input -> COLLECT.results
  - COLLECT.output -> <>
```

title: Made name in test definitions optional
body: Simple change that makes the `name` in test definitions optional.

title: Added `exec`-style SQL operation
body: This PR adds an `exec` style SQL operation that returns one value: the number of rows affected

title: Surfaced errors from sql server data conversion
body: This PR removes the hard fails on transcoding data from wick types to SQL server types and makes them errors within the wick operation lifecycle.

title: Added `ctx.inherent.timestamp`, improved error message output
body:
Propagated the timestamp to `ctx.inherent` in configuration templates (in a string format that liquid templates would treat as a date). 

Adjusted some errors that make troubleshooting the HTTP client easier during the process.

title: feat: added optionals support to azure sql impl
Made Base64Bytes the primary bytes struct, updated liquid_json
body:
The codegen was still using the `bytes::Bytes` vs `Base64Bytes` so `bytes` types weren't getting treated properly. This PR makes the codegen use `wick_component::Bytes` instead.

It also updates the `liquid-json` dependency to pull in the `base64_encode` and `base64_decode` filters.

title: Fixed middleware race condition & hidden Hyper errors
body:
This PR fixes a race condition in HTTP middleware that could cause the wrong packet to be decoded as the middleware result, leading to an error.

It also fixes a weird issue where an error in the request service would abort the request and only log a `debug` message from within hyper. This PR turns those into Internal Server Errors.

title: Added ability to pass `with` config to switch cases
body: This PR adds the ability to specify `with: ` config for the operations in switch cases. It also fixes referring to operations other than those referenced by `self::`.

title: Fixed: silenced errors from hushed modules & {{ ctx.root_config }} access in operations
body: The logger wasn't properly propagating warning or error messages from the chatty modules. This PR fixes it and fixes an issue where `root_config` was being erased before populating operation instance configuation

title: Added openapi spec generation to RestRouter
body:
This PR enables openapi spec generation from RestRouter configurations. Pair it with the `openapi-ui` component and you get swagger/openapi dev UI for free.

Example config: https://github.com/candlecorp/wick/blob/3bbcdc3f934ffcf74620b7adc316e3599f5abb38/examples/http/rest-router.wick

![Screenshot 2023-06-26 at 1 19 45 PM](https://github.com/candlecorp/wick/assets/842798/78f097ca-9e6a-4295-a6d4-16115d378887)

title: Added spread operator in SQL positional args
body:
This PR adds the `...`-style syntax to the positional arguments in the SQL component.

This change also prompted the merger of the SQLx component and the tiberius-based component to keep things in sync.

title: Config hardening
body:
This PR addresses configuration validation and template rendering. Validation and rendering happens earlier and in fewer places now.

It
- refactors config loading/access so there is a hard-typed boundary between "got a config" and "config is ready to use"
    - introduces an `UninitializedConfiguration` struct which all `WickConfiguration` fetch/load functions return. The configuration can be retrieved without processing or validation with `.into_inner()` or a configuration can be initialized and validated with `.finish()`.
    - `UninitializedConfiguration` has two methods (`.set_root_config()` and `.set_env()`) to update the context that a configuration has access to.
- fixes `ctx.env` access in trigger components
- adds tests for `wick new app --trigger *` and makes them work.
    - adds more succinct serialization of `ComponentOperationExpression` configuration
- adds `From<&str>` impl for `AssetReference`
- adds `float`, `int`, and `uint` type aliases.

title: fix: reordered error behavior variants to make ignore default
Added number type as an alias to i64
body: The interface-types parser will now parse the type name "number" as "i64"

title: Stopped input port from being pushed to on GET requests
body: GET requests were getting empty input packets which was causing downstream issues. This PR removes them.

title: Fixed panic on invalid reference format
body: This PR fixes #321 and adds `registry.candle.dev` as the default domain (was `docker.io` inherited from `oci-distribution`).

title: Updated generated markdown for enums
body: The markdown generation for enums was broken. This PR fixes it.

title: Migrated from $ENV syntax to liquid to support composite context passing
body:
This PR:
- Removes the ability to use bash-like syntax to access ENV variables.
- Adds liquid-template support to important parts of config:
  - `with:` config passing
  - in resources
  - in test data
- Note: App configurations (and test config) are the only places where `ctx.env` is populated. Composite components must define the configuration they need rather than relying on $ENV.
- Adds root component config & operation level config definition and passing to composite components, http components, and sql components (though sql components do not have any ways of accessing this data as of this PR)
- added `--op_with=` cli arg to `wick invoke` to pass operation-level config (open to naming suggestions)
